alert.note: Alert for Duval; McMullen (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 11:51AM CST until February 16 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Today... .A cold front will continue to move across South Texas early this morning. In response, strong north wind and drier conditions are expected to develop. The combination of low relative humidity values and strong wind may result in critical fire weather conditions today. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND BRUSH COUNTRY... * AFFECTED AREA...McMullen and Duval. * TIMING...From 12 PM to 2 PM CST Thursday * WINDS...North 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 21 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
